definition: to go into hiding
to hide
variant of 跡|迹[ji4]
footprint/mark/trace/vestige/sign/indication/Taiwan pr. [ji1]
variant of 跡|迹[ji4]
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low

sentences.english: The once powerful figures have also disappeared from the scene one after another.
sentences.chinese: 那些烜赫一时的人物也一个个销声匿迹了。

sentences.english: After disappearing for two years, the gangster surfaced in Thailand last month.
sentences.chinese: 在消声匿迹两年之后，那个流氓上个月在泰国露面了。

sentences.english: And yet the anger and turmoil of that period never entirely drained away.
sentences.chinese: 但那个时期爆发的怒火和动荡从未完全销声匿迹。

sentences.english: Prime ministers and presidents are here today and gone tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 国家首相和总统今天还在，明天便已消声匿迹。

sentences.english: Later, incense gradually concealment of the city.
The fashion industry would die like an insect in autumn.
sentences.chinese: 时装业将会像秋后的昆虫一样销声匿迹。

sentences.english: E. g. 6: During the two previous centuries musical styles went in one era and out of another.
sentences.chinese: 在前两个世纪，音乐风格时髦一阵，又很快销声匿迹。

sentences.english: Once a cost reduction program loses momentum, it eventually dies out.
sentences.chinese: 一旦降低成本计划失去了活力，它最终就会消声匿迹。

sentences.english: The good news is that Old Man Winter is sneaking out of town quietly, with more warmth on the way.
sentences.chinese: 好消息是冬天很快就会消声匿迹，暖天气马上到来。

sentences.english: The rumour had to disappear before facts.
sentences.chinese: 在事实面前谣言只得销声匿迹。

sentences.english: Having been stripped of all his titles, he disappeared from public life.
sentences.chinese: 他被剥夺一切荣誉之后，就从公共生活中消声匿迹了。

sentences.english: Now, however, most signs of the towns have disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 可是现在这些城镇多数已经消声匿迹了。

sentences.english: Most of the hallmarks of the foreign policy of George W. Bush are gone.
sentences.chinese: 布什的外交政策大部分的特征已经消声匿迹。

sentences.english: Onece the orbs nearby fall into the black hole, they will disappear forever.
sentences.chinese: 附近的天体一旦落入黑洞，就销声匿迹，永无踪影。

sentences.english: Little trace of our current civilisation will remain.
sentences.chinese: 我们的当前文明将消失匿迹。

definition: to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
silence/stillness
to be eradicated/to vanish/extinct/to break off relations
to vanish/to disappear from the face of the earth
to conceal one's identity/living incognito
to decline/to wane
to make one's name/to become famous
to retire (from society, esp. from politics)/to vanish
to conceal one's identity/living incognito
lit. lay down the flag and still the drums (idiom); fig. to cease/to give in
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
hibernation/living in seclusion
to transmit outwards/to disseminate/efferent (nerve)
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
clamor raises the dust (idiom); a tremendous clamor/to raise a tremendous stink
